title: AssetLib exposure
body: Is it planned to be made available via AssetLib directly from Godot?
author: ghuser404

comments.body: @ghuser404 I doubt they accept it as releases are built from closed-source repository.

Isn't the code that makes C++ scripting open-source?
I tried to understand, but I'm a bit lost as to why this project can't be fully open-source. Are you planning to monetize it?

I feel like C++ scripting is what community would love to have, but having this project closed-source can potentially push people away from it.

@ghuser404 Jenova Runtime is fully open-source. It includes everything mentioned in the repository and documentation such as C++ Scripting, Hot-Reloading, Nested Extensions, Addons etc.

### However, You need to understand there is two versions of Jenova Framework :
- **Open-Source (MIT) Version :** This version includes everything from the proprietary version before it went open-source. ~~Currently at version 0.3.4.7~~, it's designed to be cross-platform but is still not fully functional on Linux (porting state is at 95%)
- **Proprietary Version :** This version is actively developed and improved by me but it's only available for Windows. Currently at version 0.3.5.7, it is closed-source.

### What's the difference between this two :
- I develop features and improvements on the Proprietary Version first. If I find time I add these changes to the open-source version. However, there's no guarantee that the open-source version will receive all updates applied to the Proprietary Version. Once the open-source version was released, it's no longer my responsibility, though I contribute to it if time permits. Up until now, I have handled all development tasks myself including the Linux port.
- Proprietary version comes with some security measurements and code protection features, for obvious reasons those parts cannot be open source and publicized.

So to make everything clear again, This repository is totally open-source and has complete core functionality. All the black magic happening inside Jenova are present in the open-source repository.

> Are you planning to monetize it?

Not at the moment. Even the Proprietary Version is free for both personal and commercial projects.


## New Update : 
Open-Source repository updated to v0.3.5.7 with all features added to Proprietary version.

title: Jenova  Package Manager download Error on systems with Chinese language
body:
Package Manager ：There is nothing.
Godot SDK ：Can not download
Download error:Failed to Install Requested Package [a5c68457364fa7dec08b8ab225b78a92]
author: coolmoying

comments.body:
@coolmoying Hi, if you are from China or Taiwan by any chance, it's been reported that the Jenova Download Manager cannot access GitHub. I'm unsure if it's a regional issue or related to system locale and I can't fix it since I can't reproduce the issue. 

For now, the best solution is to download and install packages manually. I'm working on an option in Package Manager to install packages from disk.

title: Fixes for grammar
body: I fixed grammar issues, just that :D I am too lazy to list all the things that I did.
author: therabug

comments.body: Hey thanks for this, I have my own way of writing :D Mostly on purpose but I will apply some of changes.
